Description: Fragment of Attic black-figured pottery closed vase, olpe or amphora. Opposed palmettes linked together combined with a lotus flower and above and below the latter, a rosette. Added purple; incised details.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College Dublin, Department of Classics, Classical Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA UCD & UCC / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Ireland, Fascicule 1: University College Dublin, University College Cork (p. 17, no. 1, pl. 14, no. 1)
Vickers 1971 / Some Unpublished Sherds from Naukratis in Dublin (p. 117, no. 13, pl. 14.M)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1230)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: AN1896-1908-G.137.14a-b (Old Ashmolean Mueum accession number)
